bibliographic_metadata.Title: Porphyry copper prospectivity modelling using data driven and hybrid outranking methods: A case study of Shahr-e-Babak study area, South Eastern Iran
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Moslem Jahantigh, Hamidreza Ramazi

abstract: Identifying potential and mineralized areas with a reasonable level of confidence is a complex issue. The use of supervised methods and machine learning could help to achieve better results in such studies. This study proposes a porphyry copper mineralization model using a combination of data-driven methods, supervised machine learning, and multivariate decision-making methods. The results confirm that the MOORA method is more successful in producing the desired mineral potential model.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > tree-based > gradient boosting (GBDT); supervised > neural networks > feedforward neural network (MLP); knowledge-driven > multicriteria decision analysis > MOORA
key_points: Combination of data-driven and machine learning methods improves mineral prospectivity modeling.
MOORA method outperforms traditional machine learning methods in generating mineral potential maps.
Geological, geochemical, remote sensing, and geophysical data were integrated for analysis.
The study area is located in the Urumieh–Dokhtar Magmatic Arc, known for its porphyry copper deposits.
The results highlight the importance of lithology and geochemical signatures in predicting mineralization.
